description: Add a sqrt button with text '√' to the right of the clear button; click it to calculate the result using display content directly.
Add a square button with text '^2' to the right of the sqrt button.
Add a reciprocal button with text '1/x' to the right of the square button.
Add a sin button with text 'sin' at the end of all the buttons.
Add a π button with text 'π' to the right of the sin button; click the π button to replace display content.
Reverse the positions of the sin and π buttons, no change for other buttons.
Change the 'clear' button width to 3 columns.
Add a toggle button with id 'toggle' to change theme between dark and light mode; toggle button's text is 'dark' in light mode and 'light' in dark mode.
Move the toggle button to bottom-center of the page.
Change default theme to dark.

Add a button with id 'mode' near the toggle button to change mode between scientific (default) and basic; its text is 'basic' in scientific mode and 'scientific' in basic mode; basic mode only displays the first 5 rows of the buttons panel.
Make the last button of the first 5 rows in the buttons panel have a brighter background color; consider both dark and light modes.
Fix display input width to be equal to the buttons content width; change display input CSS properties as little as possible.
Add buttons cos, tan, sinh, cosh at the end of the buttons panel.
Add button MemoryPlus (text 'M+') at the end to add display content and store the data; add button MemoryRecall (text 'MR') before the M+ button to append stored data to display content.
Display stored data in a panel (id 'memory') next to the buttons panel in the calculator in scientific mode.
Show the latest 5 clicked button texts in a history panel (id 'clicks') next to the memory panel in scientific mode.
Add button MemoryMinus (text 'M-') next to the M+ button to subtract display content and store the data.
Add button MemoryClear (text 'MC') next to the M- button to reset stored data to 0.
Click item (class 'history-item') in the history panel to perform the same action as the calculator button.
